title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki - XWiki
content:
00:03 <Enygma`> has quit  
00:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
00:32 <sdumitriu> has quit  
00:33 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
00:33 <jvdrean> has quit  
00:47 <vmassol> has quit  
00:47 <sdumitriu> has quit  
00:48 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
02:59 <DrLou> has quit  
03:05 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
04:22 <Lycurgus> how do you make a user a member of a group in 3.2 latest?  
04:24 <DrLou> has quit  
04:26 <@cjdelisle> If you're manually adding them you can do it from the administration interface  
04:26 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:28 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:28 <Lycurgus> really, how? I was able to do for myself as admin but don't seem to be able to do so for an ordinary user.  
04:29 <@cjdelisle> oh you mean for a user to add himself to a group?  
04:30 <Lycurgus> no. Property and type list of user editing the user object class looks promising.  
04:30 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:31 <@cjdelisle> for adding a user to a group you can use the administration interface in the groups section and add any user you want to any group you want (as admin)  
04:31 <Lycurgus> I'm trying to do this manually for somebody because I didn't see anything where a user upon accepting an invitation was automatically added to a group  
04:32 <Lycurgus> ah thx, see it now  
04:32 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:33 <Lycurgus> or I thought I did  
04:34 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:34 <@cjdelisle> http://platform.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/AdminGuide/Group+Management  
04:36 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
04:38 <Lycurgus> I'm not finding that it works like that but still checking  
04:38 <Lycurgus> and I'm tired, it's late here, so may give up  
04:39 <@cjdelisle> Ok, I'll be around when you want to give it another shot. Perhaps you have javascript disabled or are using a rare browser?  
04:42 <Lycurgus> no, I got it, just was tired  
04:43 <Lycurgus> at least user appears in group  
04:45 <Lycurgus> and works.  
04:45 <sdumitriu> has quit  
04:47 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
07:48 <lucaa> has quit  
07:49 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
08:58 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:00 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:12 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:14 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki  
09:27 <sdumitriu> has quit  
09:56 <silviar> has joined #xwiki  
10:00 <sburjan> has joined #xwiki  
10:32 <jvdrean> has joined #xwiki  
11:39 <Chami1> has joined #xwiki  
11:41 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
11:45 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
11:47 <Chami1> tmortagne: hi  
11:47 <+tmortagne> Chami1: hi  
11:48 <Chami1> i'm working on instrumental testing  
11:48 <lucaa> has quit  
11:48 <Chami1> for that i need to add junit dependancy  
11:48 <Chami1> but when I build it says xwiki banned it  
11:49 <+tmortagne> that's because you added it as build dependency instead of test dependency I think  
11:49 <+tmortagne> <scoper>test</scope>  
11:49 <+tmortagne> s/scoper/scope/  
11:50 <+tmortagne> if you don't use that junit will be triggered as transitive dependency by anyone depending on your project  
11:50 <+tmortagne> which is very bad since need junit only for test and not at runtime  
11:50 <Chami1> let me check  
11:54 <Chami1> I added <scope> as test but still the same error  
11:55 <Chami1> http://pastebin.com/u3fauhyn  
11:56 <+tmortagne> we have lots of projects depending on junit as test dependency  
11:56 <+tmortagne> could I see you pom.xml ?  
11:57 <Chami1> http://pastebin.com/DJujfVBb  
11:57 <Chami1> I didn't push this pom.xml to the repo yet  
12:00 <+tmortagne> ha that's another reason actually, there is two thing forbidden with junit actually  
12:00 <+tmortagne> try junit-dep as artifact id  
12:00 <+tmortagne> instead of junit  
12:00 <+tmortagne> that's because junit trigger bad stuff (don't remember what exactly)  
12:04 <Chami1> after adding junit-dep it gives compilation error "package junit.framework does not exist" in the classes which use junit  
12:08 <+tmortagne> well I can find this package in junit-dep jar file at least  
12:08 <+tmortagne> t's junit-dep but that should not change anything  
12:08 <+tmortagne> 4.8.2  
12:09 <+tmortagne> how are intrumentation test run ?  
12:09 <+tmortagne> maybe they are not using test dependencies for some reason  
12:12 <+tmortagne> does it work without the <scope> ?  
12:13 <Chami1> I just checked without the <scope> and now it gives an error related to android.  
12:13 <Chami1> :)  
12:13 <Chami1> I will check that.  
12:14 <Chami1> without using <scope> solves it  
12:14 <+tmortagne> Chami1: do you have a link you looked at for how to setup tests ?  
12:14 <+tmortagne> ok but not using scope is not an option  
12:15 <Chami1> I referred sample projects in maven android plugin http://code.google.com/p/maven-android-plugin/wiki/AutomateAndroidTestProject  
12:16 <Chami1> There is another problem. tests cannot be performed for apklibs(Android library projects)  
12:16 <Chami1> They said that we should use seperate test project which use apklibs and then test  
12:17 <Chami1> so shall I create separate module for tests  
12:17 <Chami1> otherwise xwiki-android-components and xwiki-android-rest cannot be tested  
12:23 <xipe\_> has joined #xwiki  
12:27 <+tmortagne> Chami1: I don't see anything about junit in there  
12:27 <tmortagne> has quit  
12:27 <xipe> has quit  
12:30 <Chami1> tmortagne: download their samples. the morseflash projects consists junit testing. There documentation isn't good. but sample project have all the features in maven plugin  
12:34 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
12:39 <Chami1> tmortagne: when I added <artifactId>android-test</artifactId> for importing android test related classes again banned dependency error occured  
12:39 <Chami1> :(  
12:40 <+tmortagne> ok looks like android require some special handling of junit stuff, let me see if it's possible to disabled the enforcer for your project  
12:41 <Chami1> tmortagne: that would be good  
12:44 <+tmortagne> Chami1: for now you can use -Denforcer.skip=true when you build  
12:45 <+tmortagne> try adding  
12:45 <+tmortagne>   <properties>  
12:45 <+tmortagne>     <enforcer.skip>true</enforcer.skip>  
12:45 <+tmortagne>   </properties>  
12:45 <+tmortagne> in your pom.xml  
12:48 <Chami1> -Denforcer.skip=true is working :)  
12:48 <+tmortagne> and the property directly in the pom.xml ?  
12:51 <Chami1> where should I add properties tag in the pom  
12:52 <Chami1> within build?  
12:53 <+tmortagne> no  
12:53 <+tmortagne> at the first level  
12:53 <+tmortagne> just after <name> for example  
12:53 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
12:55 <Chami1> tmortagne: it's working :)  
12:56 <+tmortagne> Chami1: ok cool, put a nice comment explaining why you need to disable enforcer  
12:56 <Chami1> within pom?  
12:56 <+tmortagne> yes put a comment just before the property to explain why you have to do that  
12:57 <Chami1> ok.  
12:57 <Chami1> shall I make a new module for tests? otherwise it cannot be perform instrumentation test for Android Library projects  
12:58 <+tmortagne> Chami1: yes as I said having a separated project is not an issue at all  
12:59 <+tmortagne> you could even do a separated project to test the application  
13:00 <+tmortagne> forget that  
13:00 <+tmortagne> important thing to unit test is the libraries  
13:00 <+tmortagne> application is just a demo and you will not have time anyway  
13:01 <+tmortagne> don't forget to document all that on extension.xwiki.org  
13:01 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
13:01 <Chami1> tmortagne: yep. have to do lot of things in documentation. I'll plan to do extension document within this week  
13:02 <+tmortagne> ok  
13:02 <Chami1> tmortagne: ok. thanks for your help. going back to work. :)  
13:02 <+tmortagne> Chami1: you'r welcome :)  
13:04 <Chami1> has left #xwiki  
13:34 <DrLou> has joined #xwiki  
13:41 <Lycurgus> is it me or does the WYSIWYG editor do funny stuff with text?  
13:41 <vmassol> I think it's you :)  
13:41 <vmassol> (I hope at least that it's you…. ;)  
13:42 <vmassol> )  
13:42 <Lycurgus> see HTML markup appearing where I haven't put it, apparently dropped characters  
13:42 <Lycurgus> not repeatable I think seems to happen kind of randomly  
13:42 <vmassol> Lycurgus: the best is to create a jira issue if you have a problem, describing precisely how to reproduce it  
13:43 <Lycurgus> yeah, I probably am only going to be able to do that for reproducible show stoppers  
13:43 <Lycurgus> which this isn't  
13:43 <Lycurgus> either  
13:44 <Lycurgus> but it is in the latest enterprise release, not the git gotten stuff  
13:51 <vmassol> has quit  
13:55 <+tmortagne> I don't think there is much difference between the latest release and what's on git master branch for the WYSIWYG

15:46 <silviar> has joined #xwiki

15:55 <silviar1> has joined #xwiki  
15:59 <silviar> has quit  
16:01 <vmassol> cjdelisle (or anyone else): would you know how to express the following in XWQL: list me all documents having an object of type X and for which the property N is not defined or is empty?  
16:01 <vmassol> I can easily write: where doc.object(XWiki.XWikiUsers).avatar is empty  
16:01 <vmassol> but on the wiki where I'm doing this several users don't have the avatar xproperty even though they implement XWiki.XWikiUsers (imported from another wiki)  
16:02 <@cjdelisle> I'm not sure if XWQL took that into account. You can just inject HQL into the XWQL query.  
16:03 <vmassol> hmm actually found another solution  
16:03 <vmassol> it's enough to just save all users once and they'll have the avatar xproperty added  
16:03 <@cjdelisle> Can you tell me where @Intermittent is?  
16:03 <vmassol> in ui tests  
16:03 <vmassol> your IDE will autocomplete  
16:04 <@cjdelisle> Ok, I ran a find for Intermittent.java and didn't see it  
16:04 <vmassol> it's a library I've dded in the pom  
16:04 <@cjdelisle> ahh ok  
16:04 <vmassol> (not our code)  
16:04 <vmassol> it's documented actually  
16:04 <vmassol> wait  
16:04 <vmassol> (I sent a mail about it)  
16:04 <vmassol> hmm xwiki.org doesn't answer  
16:04 <vmassol> jsut slow  
16:05 <vmassol> here: http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HSelenium2-basedFramework  
16:05 <vmassol> (click on the Tempus Fugit link there)  
16:05 <@cjdelisle> I ran the actual test as a unit test 100,000 times and there was no failure.  
16:05 <vmassol> you should try with ui tests, it happens quite often, it's probably a combination of things  
16:06 <vmassol> one thing I was wondering  
16:06 <vmassol> was whether chrome was doing look aheads  
16:06 <@cjdelisle> new XWikiAttachment() ... setContent() ... getContent() ... compare  
16:06 <vmassol> and whether that ocould cause it  
16:06 <@cjdelisle> hmm  
16:06 <vmassol> if while it's doing a look ahead you click on the attachment  
16:06 <vmassol> that said I put synchronized keywords in several places to try to avoid that  
16:07 <vmassol> but maybe not everywhere  
16:07 <@cjdelisle> Speaking of synchronized, I see the number of Utils.getComponent() calls is creeping up and up. That syncs a global mutex IIRC.  
16:09 <vmassol> re my earlier question, is there a way even with HQL to tell whether a property exists?  
16:09 <@cjdelisle> It's been done I'm sure.  
16:10 <vmassol> yep found  
16:10 <vmassol> from Cat cat where exists elements(cat.kittens)  
16:10 <vmassol> hmm that's to test existence in a list  
16:11 <lucaa> has quit  
16:12 <@cjdelisle> I suspect:  SELECT doc.fullName FROM XWikiDocument as doc, BaseObject as obj, BaseProperty as prop WHERE obj.name = doc.fullName AND prop.id = obj.id AND EXISTS prop  
16:12 <vmassol> trying  
16:13 <vmassol> hmm you'd need to specify which property  
16:14 <@cjdelisle> AND prop.classType LIKE '%StringProperty'  
16:15 <vmassol> still missing which property to look for  
16:16 <vmassol> btw my need is to test for non existence  
16:17 <vmassol> hmm if we could list all properties then I could use a not exists elements(....)  
16:17 <@cjdelisle> I have done that with attachments  
16:18 <@cjdelisle> I think "= null" does the right thing but I can't remember for sure off the top of my head.  
16:18 <vmassol> I tried is null but it dodn't work  
16:18 <vmassol> will try = null now  
16:19 <vmassol> doesn't work, it's invalid  
16:19 <@cjdelisle> ahh nested query  
16:19 <@cjdelisle> http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3672444/where-exists-in-hibernate-hql  
16:20 <vmassol> indeed I could list all props  
16:20 <@cjdelisle> the query planner in any decent db will solve that  
16:21 <+tmortagne> in case you don't read you mails https://github.com/xwiki-contrib/xwiki-debian is ready to be merged in platform I think ;)  
16:21 <vmassol> (I saw the mail tmortagne just didn't reply yet)  
16:21 <vmassol> (thanks)  
16:22 <vmassol> I take my time, I'm on holidays!  
16:23 <+tmortagne> vmassol: yep I know, was a general message since I did not get much answers :)  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> Finally got the Lucene plugin to compile on top of Lucene 3.3  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> Now going into performance improvements  
16:25 <@sdumitriu> Creating new searchers for each search is sooooo baaaaad  
16:30 <vmassol> has quit  
16:47 <silviar1> has quit  
16:56 <abusenius> has joined #xwiki  
16:56 <jamesxu> has joined #xwiki  
17:04 <+sburjan> cjdelisle: ping  
17:04 <@cjdelisle> yup  
17:05 <+sburjan> could you give me the link to the fs storage documentation ? I'd like to test it.  
17:05 <@cjdelisle> FS attachment storage?  
17:05 <+sburjan> file system storage  
17:06 <@cjdelisle> storage of what?  
17:07 <+sburjan> attachments  
17:07 <@cjdelisle> ok  
17:07 <+sburjan> didn;t you wrote a module that saves attachments of fs instead of db ?  
17:07 <@cjdelisle> There's the Cassandra thing which is held together with ducttape and bailing wire right now, I wasn't sure if you wanted to try and build that ;)  
17:07 <+sburjan> no no .. not cassandra :)  
17:07 <+sburjan> the older one :)  
17:08 <@sdumitriu> http://www.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/ReleaseNotes/ReleaseNotesXWikiEnterprise30#HFilesystemAttachmentStorage  
17:08 <@cjdelisle> http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Filesystem+Attachment+Porter  
17:09 <@cjdelisle> that has a lot of information about how to set it up for different uses  
17:11 <+sburjan> do we have this in 2.7.1 ?  
17:11 <+sburjan> guess not  
17:29 <@sdumitriu> OK to migrate and clean everything from https://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/contrib/projects/ ?  
17:35 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
17:56 <jamesxu> has quit  
18:02 <vmassol> has quit  
18:18 <cjdelisle> has quit  
18:23 <cjdelisle> has joined #xwiki  
18:30 <Lycurgus> what is the superadmin userid on the xem standalone?  
18:31 <@sdumitriu> Initially, nobody, you have to import the default xar  
18:31 <@sdumitriu> You should already have admin rights on an empty wiki  
18:32 <@sdumitriu> Before logging in  
18:32 <Lycurgus> no turns out to be "Superadmin"  
18:32 <Lycurgus> at least it accepted that  
18:33 <Lycurgus> but yeah, it's empty, wasn't sure if the superadmin login would reveal something different, thx  
18:34 <@sdumitriu> Weird  
18:34 <@sdumitriu> Did you enable superadmin in xwiki.cfg?  
18:34 <Lycurgus> yes  
18:35 <Lycurgus> I enabled the password, it didn't work with "Admin" though.  
18:35 <sburjan> has quit  
18:36 <@sdumitriu> Then it's OK, superadmin is the right user  
18:39 <tmortagne> has quit  
18:39 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
18:41 <Lycurgus> :)  
18:45 <jvdrean> has quit  
18:52 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki

18:59 <sdumitriu> has joined #xwiki

19:11 <tmortagne> has quit  
19:27 <abusenius> has quit  
19:34 <Lycurgus> will 3.1 plugins work with 3.2?  
19:34 <Lycurgus> (in general)  
19:35 <@cjdelisle> they should but usually the plugins are released with the wiki so there's no reason not to use the 3.2 plugins  
19:35 <@cjdelisle> unless you're talking about a different kind of plugin than what I'm thinking  
19:36 <Lycurgus> I meant like the XEM  
19:36 <@cjdelisle> That is not tested but it should work.  
19:36 <Lycurgus> but yeah the general case more valuable info, thx  
19:37 <Lycurgus> cjdelisle, acknowledged, thx  
19:41 <vmassol> cjdelisle: here's what I was doing earlier: http://extensions.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Extension/Gravatar+Import  
19:46 <@cjdelisle> haha nice.  
19:55 <vmassol> has quit  
19:57 <mbryant> has joined #xwiki  
19:58 <mbryant> sorry guys I had to go unexpectantly, but I am in the same vm as XWiki, regestered as a component, and I was curious what the proper flow and/or api calls from java would be to create a page, with conent as well as place an object "on" a page, meaning having it attached to the page, with attributes.  
19:58 <mbryant> so step one would be to create the page, and then step two place the object on the page  
19:59 <@cjdelisle> Ahh, you can look at implementing a ScriptService  
19:59 <@cjdelisle> then you will be able to access your component through $services.yourComponent.doSomething()  
19:59 <Lycurgus> so I believe I've found a reproducible bug. Where would I report this?  
20:00 <@cjdelisle> jira.xwiki.org is the place to report bugs.  
20:01 <mbryant> @cjdelisle was this to me?  
20:01 <@cjdelisle> yes, let me get you a link to some information about script services.  
20:06 <Lycurgus> the problem is that removing a user from a group doesn't seem to work. I'll wait till I can reproduce it in trunk thoug.  
20:06 <Lycurgus> h  
20:06 <Lycurgus> or my snap of trunk  
20:07 <@cjdelisle> hmm that sounds pretty serious  
20:08 <@cjdelisle> mbryant: Here's an example https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/blob/master/xwiki-platform-core/xwiki-platform-crypto/src/main/java/org/xwiki/crypto/internal/scripting/CryptoScriptService.java  
20:09 <@cjdelisle> You add a component which implements ScriptService and the @Component() "hint" is the name which it will have. So where that is @Component("crypto") it is accessable as $services.crypto  
20:10 <@cjdelisle> and you can access that from a velocity script so any calls which you need to make into your code can be done right through that interface.  
20:12 <mbryant> right i know, that, and am already doing that, but I am needing to build a page inside of java code, much like a logger for events. basicaly I have a service sending a restful message to my component, and I need to take the data given by that service, and create a page, with an object on it (in java) because of specific parsing and calculations i need to do. and then use the xwiki api java calls,  
20:12 <mbryant> to create the page. its those api calls that I am looking for  
20:13 <@cjdelisle> I would make java code return the some type of data like a hashmap or arraylist which is then manipulated in velocity to make the page. Actually writing html in java usually turns out to be a mistake.  
20:14 <mbryant> in essence i want to create a page and object without using the gui system to do it  
20:14 <mbryant> and can i have the page create it automatically? everytime i get a ping?  
20:15 <@cjdelisle> gui? you mean without going through xwiki?  
20:15 <@cjdelisle> I don't follow  
20:15 <mbryant> okay, so it is not going to be a "user" created page persay, its more like a bot publishing events  
20:17 <mbryant2> has joined #xwiki  
20:18 <mbryant2> sorry net problems... I am basically building a component (bot) that will create pages to report specific events that my users will be able to see and analyize.  
20:18 <@cjdelisle> ok so you have to decide if you want to store the events in the database every time you get new information or if you want to store events in the bot and then render them when the user loads the page.  
20:19 <@cjdelisle> Also you might want to take a look at how the IRC bot works, it saves the page with the log every time someone types a line into this channel.  
20:20 <mbryant> has quit  
20:21 <mbryant2> it is deff the first one, everytime there is new infomration passed to my bot, I want to create a new independent page with that information  
20:22 <@cjdelisle> I see, then you want to go the other way around, you want to get at the XWiki api from your bot.  
20:22 <mbryant2> right.  
20:23 <@cjdelisle> the easiest way to do this IMO is to get the XWiki object and use the regular get/save document api functiond  
20:23 <@cjdelisle> \*functions  
20:24 <mbryant2> can you point me to the API for these by chance?  
20:25 <mbryant2> i figured it was a pretty easy thing to do, I just couldnt find the right APIs to get it done and that is basically what I was looking for  
20:26 <@cjdelisle> hmm there's a way but it only works in the context of a request.  
20:27 <@cjdelisle> So if someone goes to a page to start the bot then the page request will work, otherwise it won't.  
20:29 <mbryant2> thats less than ideal but doable, if it remains active as long as xwiki is active. (if xwiki is restarted, i understand that i might have to got to a page and click a button)  
20:30 <@cjdelisle> I'm sure there are other ways to get it to work but this is the one on the top of my head right now.  
20:32 <@cjdelisle> http://svn.xwiki.org/svnroot/xwiki/platform/xwiki-plugins/tags/xwiki-plugin-skinx-1.21/src/main/java/org/xwiki/skinx/AbstractWrapperSkinExtension.java  
20:32 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
20:32 <@cjdelisle> That gets hold of the XWiki object which is the center of the old core.  
20:32 <@cjdelisle> It has all of the functions you are familiar with such as getDocument()  
20:33 <mbryant2> if it helps, we are on 3.1  
20:34 <@cjdelisle> Yup, this has all been the same since 1.x  
20:35 <@cjdelisle> once you have the com.xpn.xwiki.XWiki object and com.xpn.xwiki.XWikiContext objects, you can make the com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki object that you are familiar with.  
20:36 <@cjdelisle> com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki xwiki = new com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki(context.getWiki(), context);  
20:36 <@cjdelisle> that will make you an "xwiki" object just like the one you are familiar with in velocity and groovy scripting.  
20:37 <@cjdelisle> You see the line that you're interested in in the link I pasted?  
20:38 <mbryant2> XWikiContext xwikiContext = (XWikiContext) execution.getContext().getProperty("xwikicontext"); ?  
20:40 <@cjdelisle> yup that's the one  
20:41 <@cjdelisle> beware: there are 2 XWiki classes, one is internal and we might break things in it at any time, the other is the one which is described in the scripting documentation.  
20:41 <@cjdelisle> you want com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki  
20:41 <@cjdelisle> but context.getWiki() will give you the internal one.  
20:42 <@cjdelisle> hence:  
20:42 <@cjdelisle> com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki xwiki = new com.xpn.xwiki.api.XWiki(context.getWiki(), context);

20:46 <@cjdelisle> yes, it would put the context into a thread local map where it can be accessed through the Execution.  
20:47 <@cjdelisle> But it could call itself easily enough, you could cheat and use commons HttpClient or dig through the code and try to make a context without having a request to begin with.  
20:49 <mbryant2> i like cheating.. so use the xwiki commons httpclient context to set mine, and then build the api object from that?  then i can pragmaticaly creat independent pages, with objects, and publish (save) them.  Do i pretty much have that right?  
20:50 <@cjdelisle> Nope, it's apache commons HttpClient. it's pretty well documented and it's already included in XWiki do all you need to do is pull it in with include statements.  
20:52 <mbryant2> right, thats what you use for your restful interface.  
20:54 <@cjdelisle> yup, just fire up a page with that, you will end up with a different thread where you can get the Xiki object from but it should even be possible to hand the object across threads and let the other one end (I'm not entirely sure on that)
